The Educational Technology Center (ETC) provides support hours for faculty to work on course material or other instructional technologies with the assistance of ETC staff. These support hours are not intended to replace training or scheduled appointments with ETC staff. If you need assistance, but are unable to attend during the support hours, please fill out the ETC Service Request Form (www.msudenver.edu…) to schedule an appointment. Be sure to provide the course information and CRN and a brief description of the issue. Someone will respond within 48 hours during the work week. The lab is located in Central Classroom 220A.

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Tuesday, August 25, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

Contact Name: Perla Gheiler
Contact Email: pgheiler@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Arts & Cultural, Signature Event (President's Office Only)

entry.content:
Student Success Building, Office of Admissions
Tuesday, August 25, 2015, 2 – 3:30pm

The tour will begin in the Office of Admissions – Station 1, located on the first floor of the Student Success Building.  Tours are about 90 minutes long and include a short information session by an MSU Denver Admissions representative followed by a campus tour led by one of our student ambassadors. You may also meet with an admissions counselor before or after your tour.

When you come to campus for the tour, be sure to park in the Tivoli Parking Garage on the MSU Denver north side of the Tivoli Student Union so that we may validate your parking (bring the ticket with you that you receive upon entering the lot for validation).

entry.title: President’s Welcome Back
entry.content:
Student Success Building Courtyard
Wednesday, September 2, 2015, 7 – 9am



Faculty and staff are invited to join Stephen Jordan, Ph.D., as he kicks off the fall semester with the President’s Welcome Back address on Sept. 2 from 7 to 9 a.m. in front of the Student Success Building.

As part of the University’s 50th anniversary year, Jordan will look back at some of the successes from our first five decades and reflect on his own 11 years as president. He also will share a preview of the year ahead, including the announcement of new initiatives, and updates on those already underway.

Refreshments will be available at 7 a.m. and the program will begin promptly at 8 a.m.

Contact Name: Perla Gheiler
Contact Email: pgheiler@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Signature Event (President's Office Only)
Audience: Current Students, Faculty Members, Staff Members
Event Sponsor: Office of the President

Class Dates: Topics addressed in this hands-on session include creating, grading and deploying tests.  We will discuss question types, pools, and question sets for employing randomization of questions.  Setting the options for the test is where attendees will set availability and due dates, enable a timer, select number of attempts and determine the feedback and results that will be displayed to students., Use your MSU Denver e-mail address when registering.  Registration closes at 7:00 a.m. the day prior to the start of this session

entry.title: New Employee Orientation
entry.content:
Student Success Building, Suite 304
Tuesday, September 8, 2015, 8:30am – 5pm

We are very pleased that you have decided to join the MSU Denver family. It's a great day to be a Roadrunner! Welcome aboard. As a new employee, you may have a number of questions, and we would like to assist you in getting acclimated to the University.

If you are a NEW Administrator or Classified employee, please register for New Employee Orientation (NEO). NEO is held on the first and third Monday of each month, unless the Monday falls on a holiday, then the orientation will be held on the following Tuesday. Orientation is an all-day event, and attendance is mandatory. Breakfast, lunch and MSU Denver gear is provided.

entry.title: PeopleAdmin Training 7.0
entry.content:
SSB 304 (HR Training Room)
Thursday, September 10, 2015, 9 – 10am

This training will cover creating new positions, updating/modifying current positions and posting positions to be filled using the PeopleAdmin 7.0 system. There will be a PowerPoint presentation that will walk you, screen by screen, through the system and discuss the steps in the approval process. Participants will log-onto a test environment and practice within the system, with an administrator available to assist and answer questions.

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Thursday, September 10, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Tuesday, September 15, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: Ian Boyden Lecture
entry.content:
Center for Visual Art
965 Santa Fe Drive
Denver, CO 80204
Wednesday, September 16, 2015, 5 – 6pm

Ian Boyden works across multiple media including painting, sculpture, artist's books, photography, site-specific installations, and land art. Consistent across his productions is an intense interest in material relevance, place-based thought, and ecology, with a deep awareness of East Asian aesthetics. He studied for several years in China and Japan, and ultimately received degrees in the History of Art from Wesleyan University (Middletown, CT) and Yale University. His work is interdisciplinary, and he often collaborates with a variety of scientists, poets, composers, and other visual artists. Boyden's work has been described as simultaneously geological and lyrical, industrial and mystical, dreamlike and archetypal. His art often links the literary, material, and visual imaginations, paying keen attention to how his work can shape ecological awareness. Boyden makes his own paints and inks, often from unusual materials such as meteorites, shark teeth, freshwater pearls, and carbon sourced from the aftermath of forest fires. His work has been exhibited widely, including a recent solo exhibition at the I.M Pei designed Suzhou Museum. His books and paintings are found in many public collections including Reed College, Stanford University, the Portland Art Museum, and the Victoria & Albert Museum.

Contact Name: Lauren Barnett

Audience: Admitted Students, Alumni, Community Members, Current Students, Donors, Faculty Members, First Year Success, Parents and Families, Prospective Students, Staff Members, Transfer Students
Event Sponsor: Center for Visual Art

entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Thursday, September 17, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: New Employee Orientation
entry.content:
Student Success Building, Suite 304
Monday, September 21, 2015, 8:30am – 5pm

We are very pleased that you have decided to join the MSU Denver family. It's a great day to be a Roadrunner! Welcome aboard. As a new employee, you may have a number of questions, and we would like to assist you in getting acclimated to the University.

If you are a NEW Administrator or Classified employee, please register for New Employee Orientation (NEO). NEO is held on the first and third Monday of each month, unless the Monday falls on a holiday, then the orientation will be held on the following Tuesday. Orientation is an all-day event, and attendance is mandatory. Breakfast, lunch and MSU Denver gear is provided.

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Tuesday, September 22, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: 2015 Sankofa Lecture Series
entry.content:
St Cajetans, Lawrence Way
Denver, CO 80204
Thursday, September 24, 2015, 8am – 3pm



Hip Hop: A Soundtrack for Social Change is the theme of the 2015 Sankofa Lecture Series, the only conference in the Colorado region that situates the study of Hip Hop culture as a site of cultural literacy, identity formation, and tool for innovative and effective teaching practices. This year’s keynote address will be provided by 9th Wonder, an incomparable music Producer, DJ and college Professor.


Other activities during the event include a film screening and discussion of the critically acclaimed documentary, Hip Hop Hijabis; a featured talk by Dr. Regina N. Bradley, Assistant Professor and curator of the interactive web dialogue “Outkasted Conversations;” and informative panel sessions with members of MSU Denver's student body and faculty.


This event is FREE and open to the public.

Sponsored by MSU Denver:
Department of Africana Studies
Office of the Provost
Alumni Relations
Department of English
First-Year Writing Program
Department of History
Office of International Studies
Department of Music
Department of Political Science
Department of Sociology and Anthropology

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Thursday, September 24, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

Class Dates: Attendees will become familiar with the basic functions of the LMS.  Topics covered include logging in, migrating courses, uploading files, navigation and an overview of these tools:  tests, assignments, grade center, discussion board and e-mail.  Finally, we will discuss and use the Student Preview which allows instructors to view the course as a student., Use your MSU Denver e-mail address when registering.  Registration closes at 7:00 a.m. the day prior to the start of this session.

entry.content:
MSU Denver Studio Theatre, King Center Room 155
Saturday, September 26, 2015, 10pm – 12am

Please join the MSU Denver Theatre Department in celebrating our alumni and honoring Marilyn "Cookie" Hetzel:  Grease will be her 50th production directed at MSU Denver.

The MSU Denver Theatre Department has created an endowed scholarship in Cookie's name.  The Dr. Mariyn "Cookie" Hetzel Endowed Theatre Scholarship has been established to support Theatre Majors involved in the Theatre Production Program at MSU Denver.

1950's Attire Welcome, but not Mandatory.

Tickets to the fundraiser are $20.00 please call 303-556-3073 or go to www.ahec.edu/boxoffice.

Monday, September 28, 2015, 3 – 4pm

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Tuesday, September 29, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Thursday, October 1, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: New Employee Orientation
entry.content:
Student Success Building, Suite 304
Monday, October 5, 2015, 8:30am – 5pm

We are very pleased that you have decided to join the MSU Denver family. It's a great day to be a Roadrunner! Welcome aboard. As a new employee, you may have a number of questions, and we would like to assist you in getting acclimated to the University.

If you are a NEW Administrator or Classified employee, please register for New Employee Orientation (NEO). NEO is held on the first and third Monday of each month, unless the Monday falls on a holiday, then the orientation will be held on the following Tuesday. Orientation is an all-day event, and attendance is mandatory. Breakfast, lunch and MSU Denver gear is provided.

entry.title: Civic Center Walking Tour
entry.content:
MSU Denver booth at Civic Center EATS
Thursday, October 8, 2015, 10:45am – 12pm



As part of MSU Denver’s 50th anniversary celebration, and in cooperation with LearnOn – MSU Denver’s continuing education program – the University is offering historic walking tours through Civic Center Park with Kevin Rucker, professor of history. Rucker will regale participants with “tales of early Denver’s ghosts, movers and shakers, conmen, scalawags and scoundrels.”

The one-hour tours will start at 11 a.m. The tours cost $5 for MSU Denver faculty, staff and students. Sign up and reserve your spot today.

entry.title: Blackboard Faculty Support Hours
entry.content:
CN 220A
Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12 – 2pm

The Educational Technology Center (ETC) provides support hours for faculty to work on course material or other instructional technologies with the assistance of ETC staff. These support hours are not intended to replace training or scheduled appointments with ETC staff. If you need assistance, but are unable to attend during the support hours, please fill out the ETC Service Request Form (www.msudenver.edu…) to schedule an appointment. Be sure to provide the course information and CRN and a brief description of the issue. Someone will respond within 48 hours during the work week. The lab is located in Central Classroom 220A.

entry.title: Indoor Cycling
entry.content:
PE 201- Fitness Loft
Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12 – 12:50pm

This low-impact, music-driven, varied-intensity workout achieves great cardio benefits and calorie burning.  Our cycles are fully adjustable making this appropriate for all levels from a new rider to a seasoned cyclist. Bikes compatible with athletic shoes and SPD cleats. Bring water and a towel. Instructor: T/Th-Rowan *Group Fitness classes are FREE to current students by showing a current ID card. Faculty and staff must have a current Campus Recreation Membership to attend Group Fit Classes.
